intro: Aiouea multiflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Aiouea multiflora plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
